image.altText: Graphic collage showing a Australian money, an ATO building, the myGov app, and a shadowy figure walking.

props.synopsis: It was a scam so simple it took just minutes on your phone, where you could tell the tax office how much money to pay you, and it came through within days.

title.children: The ATO was warned its systems were lacking, then scammers stole $2b

image.altText: An airplane drops humanitarian aid over Gaza

props.synopsis: Israel is halting the bombardment of densely populated parts of Gaza for 10 hours a day, as it yields to international pressure to let more aid into the war-ravaged strip.

title.children: Israel announces 'pause' to fighting in parts of Gaza as aid drops resume

image.altText: Penny Wong

props.synopsis: French President Emmanuel Macron's move to announce France's intention to recognise Palestine in September renews conversations about the issue in Australia.

title.children: Wong says there are 'challenges' to overcome before Palestinian recognition happens

image.altText: Ursula von der Leyen and Donald Trump sitting in a golf club meeting room.

props.synopsis: The deal, which sees European imports to the US levied a flat 15 per cent tariff, will affect a third of global trade.

title.children: US and European Union reach trade deal during Trump golf trip

image.altText: A composite image shows US President Donald Trump and China's Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: The AI battle between China and the US is less about profits and return on investment, and more about geopolitics — national machismo, security and defence.

title.children: US, China in battle to own first artificial general intelligence

image.altText: Ley and Albanese walk down the aisle in the senate chamber

props.synopsis: While the Liberals are showing signs they have not left the last election behind, Labor faces pressure from within to change its policy on Palestine.

title.children: Labor and Liberals facing internal fault lines as parliament resumes

image.altText: Jane Dudley

props.synopsis: After 18 years with bipolar 1 disorder, an Australian woman's life has been changed by a poo transplant from her partner.

title.children: DIY poo transplant leads to 'miraculous' mental health change

image.altText: The podium placers on a F1 race walking from the stage, through a walkway, with their trophies

props.synopsis: An early overtake and masterclass in tyre management has guided Oscar Piastri to victory in the Belgian Grand Prix, extending his lead in the drivers' championship to 16 points.

title.children: Piastri beats Norris in Belgium to extend F1 championship lead

image.altText: Albanese holds up a Medicare card.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese signals a focus on Labor's election promises even as speculation builds about tax changes planned for August's roundtable.

title.children: Cheaper medicines and HECS top parliamentary agenda as tax debate ramps up

image.altText: AI child abuse phone generic

props.synopsis: MP Kate Chaney is set to introduce a bill to criminalise the use of AI tools purpose-built to create child sexual abuse material, with the independent saying the urgent issue cannot wait for the government's wider response to artificial intelligence.

title.children: Laws to criminalise AI child abuse apps to be introduced to parliament

image.altText: A train on its side with several workers in hard hats walking around it.

props.synopsis: The regional passenger train had about 100 people onboard at the time of the crash.

title.children: Train derails in Germany killing at least three people

image.altText: Four people seated at a table look at a camera smiling.

props.synopsis: Multiple fatal crashes involving Indonesian drivers on work and holiday visas prompt calls for better support inexperienced drivers who need transport to work in regional areas.

title.children: Calls for Australia to tighten overseas drivers licence rules

image.altText: Two houses with smoking chimneys and city in background.

props.synopsis: Wood heaters are estimated to be responsible for more pollution-related deaths than all the cars on our roads. This national map shows which areas are affected the most.

title.children: Wood heater smoke is a silent killer but one city tops the list

image.altText: Damage along the front left of an aircraft named Virgin Australia

props.synopsis: A Virgin Australia plane becomes disconnected from a tug vehicle and collides into it at Tullamarine airport.

title.children: Virgin plane collides with tug vehicle at Melbourne Airport

image.altText: A shadowy outline of a man sitting in a chair by a window

props.synopsis: There's growing calls from the youth and domestic and family violence sector for more financial support to assist the queer, trans and gender diverse community.

title.children: Alex's boyfriend put a tracking app on his phone 'to keep him safe'

image.altText: Chloe Kelly lifts the Women's Euros trophy above her head after the final against Spain.

props.synopsis: England goes back-to-back at the women's Euro, beating World Cup winners Spain 3-1 in a penalty shootout.

title.children: Lionesses exact World Cup revenge on Spain, winning Euro final on penalties

image.altText: Three women in Australian swimming outfits celebrating together.

props.synopsis: The all-conquering women's 4x100m freestyle team's victory extends a championship-winning run that began in 2018.

title.children: Australian relay teams win gold on day one of world swimming championships

image.altText: Landslide boulder at Great mackerel beach in Sydney's northern beaches

props.synopsis: In October 2020, a landslide cascaded down a slope in Sydney's Northern Beaches, sending down boulders that took out the side of the Kemp family's house.

title.children: A retirement dream house left to rot five years after Sydney landslide

image.altText: Close-up of the hands of election workers counting votes

props.synopsis: With the methodical counting of votes crawling towards a result after the July 19 Tasmanian state election, some prominent faces might miss out — while others could scrape across the line.

title.children: How the 'brutal mathematics' of Tasmania's vote count could end candidate hopes

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt is surrounded by reporters with microphones and cameras.

props.synopsis: The star of hit Netflix series Wild Croc Territory, Matt Wright, will face trial in the NT Supreme Court this week for allegedly perverting the course of justice. It comes three years on from a chopper accident which killed his co-star and close friend, Chris "Willow" Wilson.

title.children: What to expect from the trial of celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing navy blue police uniform looks on sideways

props.synopsis: Victoria does not need a permit system for protests, says the state's new top cop, who concedes there has been a breakdown in public confidence in police.

title.children: New Victorian police chief argues against permits for protesters

image.altText: A paper bag containing fresh vegetables and a packet of rice.

props.synopsis: Ready-made meals and home delivery companies are locking in long-term supply deals with farmers, who are using the guaranteed orders to help them plan ahead and avoid price volatility.

title.children: Meal kit boom helps Aussie farmers bypass supermarkets

image.altText: A pinky-purple flower with tubular petals with yellow nubs at the end.

props.synopsis: There are fewer than 1,000 in the wild, but it is hoped a group of green thumbs can help save the Tumut grevillea from extinction.

title.children: Gardeners unite to save 'spectacular' grevillea in Snowy Mountains

image.altText: A man and woman sit among others in a large crowded evacuation centre.

props.synopsis: At least 30 people are dead and more than 200,000 people displaced as the two South-East Asian neighbours accuse each other of launching artillery strikes across contested territory.

title.children: Cambodia and Thailand to hold talks as border clashes continue

image.altText: A person holds a ballot paper in a temple.

props.synopsis: A months-long campaign in Taiwan to unseat parliamentary members — some considered pro-Beijing — fails.

title.children: 'Pro-Beijing' opposition politicians survive recall election in Taiwan

image.altText: Top of 1 William Street building in Brisbane CBD, taken from South Bank with bougainvillea flowers in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A new report to be released today reveals a 5 per cent uptick in the Queensland government's workforce over a 12-month period.

title.children: More than one in four Queensland public servants earnings at least $120k

image.altText: An excavator sits atop a pile of woodchips.

props.synopsis: A former golf course in inner-Melbourne is being transformed into what the council describes as a biodiversity refuge of wetlands and wildflower meadows, but residents fear the removal of native trees is undermining the project's aims.

title.children: 'Ham-fisted' tree removal sparks concerns as golf course transformed

image.altText: Two sea lions in a cage hooked up to fluid bags

props.synopsis: As South Australia deals with its unprecedented algal bloom, a bloom of a different kind has been decimating California's coastline for four years, killing whales, dolphins and causing sea lions to behave aggressively on beaches. Warning: This story contains content that some readers may find distressing.

title.children: As South Australia deals with its algal bloom, California is dealing with another

image.altText: A paramedic treating a patient in the back of an ambulance.

props.synopsis: Ambulance Victoria releases a toolkit to teach paramedics how to make adjustments at work to help staff and patients who are neurodiverse.

title.children: Ambulances can cause sensory overload, but a new toolkit could help

image.altText: A dark grey cockatoo on a tree branch covered in snow.

props.synopsis: Gang-gang cockatoos like cool weather, but freezing conditions are putting them at risk this winter, as volunteers race to save grounded birds in the Victorian Alps.

title.children: Race to save endangered gang-gang cockatoos grounded with frozen wings

image.altText: Three adolescent boys ride a tractor in the countryside.

props.synopsis: The French film follows a newly orphaned 18-year-old who is thrust into caring for his young sister following the untimely death of their father.

title.children: An 18-year-old takes on the cheese world in coming-of-age story Holy Cow

image.altText: Pictures of people on the beach and walking past Bondi Beach on a clear summer's day.

props.synopsis: Councils who run some of the most popular beaches in the country, including Bondi, have been asked to join a trial of removing shark nets by the New South Wales government.

title.children: Popular Sydney beaches could soon join shark net removal trial

image.altText: Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera leaps in the air in celebration

props.synopsis: St Kilda's Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera kicks a game-winning goal after the siren as the Saints overturn a 46-point three-quarter time deficit to stun Melbourne at Docklands Stadium.

title.children: Wanganeen-Milera's heroics help Saints complete greatest final quarter comeback in VFL/AFL history

image.altText: A man leaves the field due to an injury

props.synopsis: The Sea Eagles chances of playing finals football in 2025 have taken a huge hit with backrower Haumole Olakau'atu suffering another shoulder injury.

title.children: Manly lose Haumole Olakau'atu for the rest of the season with shoulder injury

image.altText: Adam Zampa playing a T20 for Australia in 2024.

props.synopsis: Australia remains unbeaten in the men's T20 series against West Indies after winning the fourth match by three wickets in Saint Kitts and Nevis.

title.children: Aussies post another T20 victory over West Indies
